elements.title: Winter Garden Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the runway at the Winter Garden Theatre (interior pictured) was nicknamed the "bridge of thighs" after lightly clothed showgirls paraded down it?

elements.title: Belinda Archer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Belinda Archer won Australia's first World Artistic Gymnastics Championships team medal in 2003?

elements.title: XF551 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that even though it was "the best thing to happen to the Atari", the XF551 floppy disk drive was only released after Nintendo sued them?

elements.title: Journal of a Voyage to the South Seas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Sydney Parkinson died on the return leg of the first voyage of James Cook, some of his drawings were engraved for publication in his Journal of a Voyage to the South Seas?

elements.title: Daniel Webster Davis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that three schools in Virginia were named after Daniel Webster Davis?

elements.title: Scanner Price Accuracy Code (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 92 percent of complaint calls about the Scanner Price Accuracy Code are not legitimate complaints?

elements.title: Charlie Bartson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after getting drunk and verbally abusing Cap Anson at a baseball game during his off day, Charlie Bartson was released from the Chicago Pirates?

elements.title: Birds Aren't Real (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Birds Aren't Real?
